messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Digest Number 3871

messages.messageBody:
Hi there! I just joined, but this happens to be one of my areas ;)
first, I would totally rethread the machine. If that doesn't resolve
it ( I am amazed at how often it does)

I would check upper thread tension - if it isn't tight enough, it will
make big loops that get stuck in the bobbin area.
If that isn't the problem, remove the bobbin case and take it all apart
as much as you can ( hard to say without knowing what machine you have)
And make sure it isn't clogged or jammed.
HTH!
--
Heather, mom to
Harriet 12.15.99
Crispin 01.25.02
heatherette@...

On Monday, July 28, 2003, at 10:40 AM,
Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> My sewing machine is jamming. The needle goes down and the bobbin area
> is
> jamming. It goes around once and then it gets wrapped up under there.
> I checked
> the needle is not in backwards and all looks/appears ok. Anyone know
> what may
> be going on?


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
